00021         backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_(255),
00022         noiseRemovalTime_(0.0),
00023         optimalThresholdComputingTime_(0.0),

00030 
00036 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00037 {
00038     // Start timing
00039     boost::timer timer;
00040     timer.restart();
00041     
00042 
00043     // Start with an initial threshold
00044     optimalThreshold_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00045     unsigned char currentThreshold = ~optimalThreshold_;    // Enforces current threshold to be different so the firts loop is always made
00046     
00047     
00048     // Loop as many times as needed to find the optimal threshold by averaging the pixel gray levels
00049     while (currentThreshold not_eq optimalThreshold_)
00050     {
00051         double backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00052         unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00053         
00054         // Count the pixels that belong to objects and the pixels that belong to background
00055         for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < clip.height(); ++i )
00056         {
00057             for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < clip.width(); ++j )
00058             {
00059                 unsigned char grayLevel = clip(i, j);
00060                 
00061                 if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold_ )
00062                 {
00063                     backgroundMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00064                     nSamples++;
00065                 }
00066                 else
00067                     objectsMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00068             }
00069         }
00070         backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / static_cast<double>(nSamples));
00071         objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / static_cast<double>(clip.size() - nSamples));
00072 
00073 
00074         // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00075         currentThreshold = optimalThreshold_;
00076         optimalThreshold_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2.0) );
00077     }
00078     
00079     // Gather elapsed time
00080     optimalThresholdComputingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00081     
00082     return optimalThreshold_;
00083 };

00096 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00097 {
00098     // Start timing
00099     boost::timer timer;
00100     timer.restart();
00101     
00102     
00103     // Compute clip's histogram
00104     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00105     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < clip.height(); ++i )
00106     {
00107         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < clip.width(); ++j )
00108         {
00109             histogram[static_cast<unsigned int>(clip(i, j))] += 1;
00110         }
00111     }
00112     
00113         
00114     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00115     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00116     unsigned int moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0;
00117     unsigned int maximumAppearances = histogram[0];
00118     
00119     for ( unsigned int l = 1; l < 256; ++l )
00120     {
00121         if ( histogram[l] > maximumAppearances )
00122         {
00123             moreFrequentGrayLevel   = l;
00124             maximumAppearances      = histogram[l];
00125         }
00126     }
00127     unsigned int referenceGrayLevel = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00128 
00129 
00130     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00131     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( std::find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00132     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00133     unsigned int nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00134 
00135     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00136     {
00137         // Search forwards
00138         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00139         {
00140             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00141             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00142 
00143             ++histogramIterator;
00144         }
00145 
00146         // Search backwards
00147         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00148         {
00149             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00150             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00151 
00152             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00153         }
00154     }
00155 
00156     // Set the background reference gray level found
00157     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round(referenceGrayLevel / nFrequencies) );
00158     
00159     // Gather elapsed time
00160     backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00161 
00162     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00163 };

00172 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00173 {
00174     // Start timing
00175     boost::timer timer;
00176     timer.restart();
00177     
00178     
00179     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00180     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00181     {
00182         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00183         {
00184             unsigned char pixelGrayLevel = clip(i, j);
00185             
00186             // Comparison values to avoid pixels that clearly belong to the background
00187             bool backgroundPixelOnWhite = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel >= backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00188             bool backgroundPixelOnBlack = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel <= backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00189             
00190             if ( not backgroundPixelOnBlack and not backgroundPixelOnWhite )
00191             {
00192                 unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00193 
00194                 // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00195                 for(int p = i-1; p < static_cast<int>(i+2); p++)
00196                 {
00197                     for(int q = j-1; q < static_cast<int>(j+2); q++)
00198                     {
00199                         // Comparison values to avoid step outside the image and the central pixel
00200                         bool heightOverflow = (p < 0) or (p >= static_cast<int>(clip.height()));
00201                         bool widthOverflow  = (q < 0) or (q >= static_cast<int>(clip.width()));
00202                         bool isCentralPixel = (p == static_cast<int>(i)) and (q == static_cast<int>(j));
00203                         
00204                         if ( not heightOverflow and not widthOverflow and not isCentralPixel )
00205                         {
00206                             // Update pixels counter
00207                             nPixels++;
00208 
00209                             // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00210                             unsigned char neighbourPixelGrayLevel = clip(p, q);
00211 
00212                             // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00213                             if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ >= optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel >= optimalThreshold_) )
00214                                 nBackgroundPixels++;
00215                             else
00216                             {
00217                                 // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00218                                 if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel <= optimalThreshold_) )
00219                                     nBackgroundPixels++;
00220                             }
00221                         }
00222                     }
00223                 }
00224 
00225                 // Clear the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00226                 if (nBackgroundPixels >= (nPixels - isolationCoefficient))
00227                     clip(i, j) = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00228             }
00229         }
00230     }
00231     
00232     // Gather elapsed time
00233     noiseRemovalTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00234 };

00239 // ///
00240 // /// @details The strategy proposed by N. Otsu in "A Threshold Selection Method from Gray-Level Histograms"
00241 // /// (IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics, 1979) maximises the likelihood that the threshold is chosen so as to split the image between
00242 // /// and object and its background. An optimal threshold is selected by the discriminant criterion, namely, so as to maximize the separability of the
00243 // /// resultant classes in gray levels. The procedure is very simple, utilizing only the zeroth- and the first-order cumulative moments of the
00244 // /// gray-level histogram.
00245 // ///
00246 // void Preprocessor::computeOtsuOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00247 // {
00248 //  // Start timing
00249 //  boost::timer timer;
00250 //  timer.restart();
00251 //  
00252 //  // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00253 //  std::vector<unsigned char> pixels   = clip.pixels();
00254 //  
00255 //  
00256 //  ///
00257 //  /// 1. Compute the gray-level histogram and normalized it.
00258 //  ///
00259 //  std::vector<double> histogram(256,0.0);
00260 //  std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00261 //  
00262 //  for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00263 //      histogram[static_cast<int>(*pixelsIterator)] += 1.0;
00264 //  
00265 //  double nPixels = static_cast<double>( clip.nPixels() );
00266 //  std::transform (histogram.begin(), histogram.end(), histogram.begin(), std::bind2nd(std::divides<double>(), nPixels) );
00267 //  
00268 //  
00269 //  ///
00270 //  /// 2. Compute the total mean level of the image \f$\mu_T\f$.
00271 //  ///
00272 //  double meanGrayLevel = 0.0;
00273 //  for ( unsigned int k = 1; k <= 256; ++k )
00274 //      meanGrayLevel += histogram[k-1] * static_cast<double>(k);
00275 //      
00276 //  
00277 //  ///
00278 //  /// 3. For each gray level \f$k\f$ compute \f$\omega(k)\f$ y \f$\mu(k)\f$, which are the zeroth- and the first-order cumulative moments of the histogram
00279 //  /// up to the \f$k\f$th level.
00280 //  ///
00281 //  std::vector<double> omega(256,0.0);
00282 //  std::vector<double> mu(256,0.0);
00283 //  for ( unsigned int k = 0; k < 256; ++k )
00284 //  {
00285 //      for ( unsigned int i = 0; i <= k; ++i )
00286 //      {
00287 //          omega[k]    += histogram[i];
00288 //          mu[k]       += histogram[i] * static_cast<double>(i+1) ;
00289 //      }
00290 //  }
00291 //  
00292 //  
00293 //  ///
00294 //  /// 4. Compute the variance of the class separability \f$\sigma_B^2(k)\f$.
00295 //  ///
00296 //  std::vector<double> sigma(256,0.0);
00297 //  for ( unsigned int k = 0; k < 256; ++k )
00298 //  {
00299 //      double numerator    = (meanGrayLevel * omega[k]) - mu[k];
00300 //      double denominator  = omega[k] - (1.0 - omega[k]);
00301 //      
00302 //      sigma[k] = pow(numerator, 2) / denominator;
00303 //  }
00304 //  
00305 //  
00306 //  ///
00307 //  /// 5. Find the \f$k\f$th level that makes a \f$\sigma_B^2(k)\f$ value the maximum.
00308 //  ///
00309 //  optimalThreshold_ = 0;
00310 //  double maximumSigma = sigma[0];
00311 //  for ( unsigned int k = 1; k < 256; ++k )
00312 //  {
00313 //      if ( sigma[k] > maximumSigma )
00314 //      {
00315 //          maximumSigma        = sigma[k];
00316 //          optimalThreshold_   = static_cast<unsigned char>(k);
00317 //      }
00318 //  }
00319 //  
00320 //  // Gather elapsed time
00321 //  optimalThresholdComputingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00322 // };
00323 
00324 
00325 
00326 // ///
00327 // /// @details To compute the optimal threshold following an adaptive strategy we divided the clip into <em>n</em> subclips and apply the Sonka's method
00328 // /// over them. Thus, a list of threshold values are returned, one for each subimage, that allows a thresholding technique to be more accurate.
00329 // ///
00330 // unsigned int Preprocessor::computeOptimalAdaptiveThreshold (const Clip &clip, std::vector<unsigned char> &thresholds)
00331 // {
00332 //  // Stablish the side's size of the subimages
00333 //  const unsigned int subclipSide  = 100;
00334 // 
00335 //  // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00336 //  std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00337 //  
00338 //  // Empty output vector
00339 //  thresholds.clear();
00340 //  
00341 //  // Explore subimages
00342 //  for ( unsigned int row = 0; row < ceil(static_cast<double>(clip.height()) / static_cast<double>(subclipSide)) ; ++row )
00343 //  {
00344 //      for ( unsigned int column = 0; column < ceil(static_cast<double>(clip.width()) / static_cast<double>(subclipSide)) ; ++column )
00345 //      {
00346 //          // Start with an initial threshold
00347 //          unsigned char optimalThreshold = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00348 //          unsigned char currentThreshold = ~optimalThreshold; // Enforces current threshold to be different so the firts loop is always made
00349 // 
00350 //          // Loop as many times as needed to find the optimal threshold by averaging the pixel gray levels
00351 //          while (currentThreshold not_eq optimalThreshold)
00352 //          {
00353 //              double backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00354 //              unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00355 // 
00356 //              for ( unsigned int i = row * subclipSide; (i < ((row * subclipSide) + subclipSide)) and (i < clip.height()); ++i )
00357 //              {
00358 //                  for ( unsigned int j = column * subclipSide; (j < ((column * subclipSide) + subclipSide)) and (j < clip.width()); ++j )
00359 //                  {
00360 //                      unsigned char grayLevel = pixels[i * clip.width() + j];
00361 // 
00362 //                      if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold )
00363 //                      {
00364 //                          backgroundMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00365 //                          nSamples++;
00366 //                      }
00367 //                      else
00368 //                          objectsMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00369 //                  }
00370 //              }
00371 // 
00372 //              backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / static_cast<double>(nSamples));
00373 //              objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / static_cast<double>(clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00374 // 
00375 // 
00376 //              // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00377 //              currentThreshold = optimalThreshold;
00378 //              optimalThreshold = static_cast<unsigned char>( round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2.0) );
00379 //          }
00380 //          thresholds.push_back(optimalThreshold);
00381 //      }
00382 //  }
00383 // 
00384 //  return thresholds.size();
00385 // };
